item.title: TypeScript
item.description:
TypeScript

Ñ§Ï°Ä¿±ê

ÕÆÎÕ TypeScript µÄºËĞÄ¸ÅÄîºÍ¿ª·¢¼¼ÄÜ£¬ÄÜ¹»Ê¹ÓÃ TypeScript ½øĞĞÇ°¶ËºÍºó¶Ë¿ª·¢¡£

ºËĞÄ¸ÅÄî

ÀàĞÍÏµÍ³

  • ¾²Ì¬ÀàĞÍ¼ì²é: ±àÒëÊ±ÀàĞÍ¼ì²é
  • ÀàĞÍÍÆ¶Ï: ×Ô¶¯ÍÆ¶Ï±äÁ¿ÀàĞÍ
  • ÀàĞÍ×¢½â: ÏÔÊ½ÉùÃ÷ÀàĞÍ

ÃæÏò¶ÔÏó

  • Àà: ÀàµÄ¶¨ÒåºÍ¼Ì³Ğ
  • ½Ó¿Ú: ½Ó¿Ú¶¨ÒåºÍÊµÏÖ
  • ·ºĞÍ: ÀàĞÍ²ÎÊı»¯

Ä£¿éÏµÍ³

  • ES6 Ä£¿é: import/export Óï·¨
  • ÃüÃû¿Õ¼ä: namespace ¹Ø¼ü×Ö
  • Ä£¿é½âÎö: Ä£¿é²éÕÒ²ßÂÔ

Ñ§Ï°Â·¾¶

µÚÒ»½×¶Î£º»ù´¡Óï·¨

  1. »ù±¾ÀàĞÍ
// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
let name: string = 'ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½'
let age: number = 25
let isStudent: boolean = true
let hobbies: string[] = ['ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½', 'ï¿½Ä¶ï¿½', 'ï¿½Ë¶ï¿½']
let tuple: [string, number] = ['ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½', 25]

// Ã¶ï¿½ï¿½
enum Color {
  Red = 'red',
  Green = 'green',
  Blue = 'blue'
}

// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
let id: string | number = '123'
id = 123

// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Í±ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
type UserId = string | number
type User = {
  id: UserId
  name: string
  age: number
}
  1. º¯ÊıÀàĞÍ
// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½×¢ï¿½ï¿½
function add(a: number, b: number): number {
  return a + b
}

// ï¿½ï¿½Í·ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
const multiply = (a: number, b: number): number => a * b

// ï¿½ï¿½Ñ¡ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Ä¬ï¿½Ï²ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
function greet(name: string, greeting?: string): string {
  return greeting ? `${greeting}, ${name}!` : `Hello, ${name}!`
}

// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
function process(x: number): number
function process(x: string): string
function process(x: number | string): number | string {
  if (typeof x === 'number') {
    return x * 2
  }
  return x.toUpperCase()
}
  1. ½Ó¿Ú
// ï¿½Ó¿Ú¶ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
interface User {
  id: number
  name: string
  email: string
  age?: number
  readonly createdAt: Date
}

// ï¿½Ó¿ï¿½Êµï¿½ï¿½
class UserImpl implements User {
  constructor(
    public id: number,
    public name: string,
    public email: string,
    public readonly createdAt: Date
  ) {}
}

// ï¿½Ó¿ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Õ¹
interface Employee extends User {
  department: string
  salary: number
}

// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Ó¿ï¿½
interface SearchFunc {
  (source: string, subString: string): boolean
}

µÚ¶ş½×¶Î£º¸ß¼¶ÌØĞÔ

  1. ·ºĞÍ
// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Íºï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
function identity<T>(arg: T): T {
  return arg
}

// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Í½Ó¿ï¿½
interface GenericIdentityFn<T> {
  (arg: T): T
}

// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
class GenericNumber<T> {
  zeroValue: T
  add: (x: T, y: T) => T
}

// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Ô¼ï¿½ï¿½
interface Lengthwise {
  length: number
}

function loggingIdentity<T extends Lengthwise>(arg: T): T {
  console.log(arg.length)
  return arg
}
  1. ¸ß¼¶ÀàĞÍ
// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
type Combined = User & Employee

// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
type Status = 'loading' | 'success' | 'error'

// Ó³ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
type Partial<T> = {
  [P in keyof T]?: T[P]
}

type Required<T> = {
  [P in keyof T]-?: T[P]
}

// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
type NonNullable<T> = T extends null | undefined ? never : T

// Ä£ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
type EmailLocaleIDs = "welcome_email" | "email_heading"
type FooterLocaleIDs = "footer_title" | "footer_sendoff"
type AllLocaleIDs = `${EmailLocaleIDs | FooterLocaleIDs}_id`
  1. ×°ÊÎÆ÷
// ï¿½ï¿½×°ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
function sealed(constructor: Function) {
  Object.seal(constructor)
  Object.seal(constructor.prototype)
}

@sealed
class Greeter {
  greeting: string
  constructor(message: string) {
    this.greeting = message
  }
  greet() {
    return "Hello, " + this.greeting
  }
}

// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½×°ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
function log(target: any, propertyKey: string, descriptor: PropertyDescriptor) {
  const method = descriptor.value
  
  descriptor.value = function (...args: any[]) {
    console.log(`Calling ${propertyKey} with:`, args)
    const result = method.apply(this, args)
    console.log(`Result:`, result)
    return result
  }
}

class Calculator {
  @log
  add(a: number, b: number): number {
    return a + b
  }
}

  1. React + TypeScript
// ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Props ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
interface UserCardProps {
  user: User
  onEdit?: (user: User) => void
  onDelete?: (id: number) => void
}

const UserCard: React.FC<UserCardProps> = ({ user, onEdit, onDelete }) => {
  return (
    <div className="user-card">
      <h3>{user.name}</h3>
      <p>{user.email}</p>
      {onEdit && <button onClick={() => onEdit(user)}>ï¿½à¼­</button>}
      {onDelete && <button onClick={() => onDelete(user.id)}>É¾ï¿½ï¿½</button>}
    </div>
  )
}

// Hook ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
function useLocalStorage<T>(key: string, initialValue: T) {
  const [storedValue, setStoredValue] = useState<T>(() => {
    try {
      const item = window.localStorage.getItem(key)
      return item ? JSON.parse(item) : initialValue
    } catch (error) {
      return initialValue
    }
  })

  const setValue = (value: T | ((val: T) => T)) => {
    try {
      const valueToStore = value instanceof Function ? value(storedValue) : value
      setStoredValue(valueToStore)
      window.localStorage.setItem(key, JSON.stringify(valueToStore))
    } catch (error) {
      console.error(error)
    }
  }

  return [storedValue, setValue] as const
}
  1. Node.js + TypeScript
// Express Ó¦ï¿½ï¿½
import express, { Request, Response, NextFunction } from 'express'

interface UserRequest extends Request {
  user?: User
}

const app = express()

// ï¿½Ğ¼ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
const authMiddleware = (req: UserRequest, res: Response, next: NextFunction) => {
  const token = req.headers.authorization?.split(' ')[1]
  if (!token) {
    return res.status(401).json({ message: 'Î´ï¿½ï¿½È¨' })
  }
  // ï¿½ï¿½Ö¤ token ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Ã»ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Ï¢
  req.user = { id: 1, name: 'ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½', email: 'test@example.com' }
  next()
}

// Â·ï¿½É´ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
app.get('/api/users/:id', authMiddleware, (req: UserRequest, res: Response) => {
  const userId = parseInt(req.params.id)
  const user = req.user
  
  res.json({ user, requestedId: userId })
})
